humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the maximum dimension of the invasive component of the tumor, which is 8.3 cm. This is larger than the threshold for T1 (2 cm) and T2 (5 cm) tumors, so the T stage must be T3 or T4. Since there is no indication of direct extension to the chest wall or skin, the T stage is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is based on the size of the tumor. In this report, the maximum dimension of the invasive component of the tumor is 8.3 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T3 stage is assigned when the tumor is more than 5 cm in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T3.
